What's on in Parliament

Tuesday 25 April 2017

Print Events
  • House of Commons
  • House of Lords
Loading...

The edited verbatim report of proceedings in the Commons and the Lords on this date can be found in the Official Report (Hansard)

Read the Official Report (Hansard)

Transcripts of select committee evidence sessions that took place on this date are published on the relevant committee's pages.

View the Committee A-Z

Main Chamber

2.30 pm

Oral questions

Preventing leaseholders whose leases do not permit short-term sub-letting from registering with holiday letting firms - Baroness Gardner of Parkes

Oral questions

Promotion of UK-Africa trade and development in the transitional and post-Brexit periods - Lord Oates

Oral questions

Improving standards of literacy in the workforce - Baroness Rebuck

Oral questions

Allowing British citizens who have lived outside the UK for more than 15 years to vote in the General Election - Baroness Walmsley

Legislation

Northern Ireland (Ministerial Appointments and Regional Rates) Bill - 1st reading - Lord Dunlop

Legislation

Technical and Further Education Bill - Consideration of Commons amendments - Lord Nash

Legislation

Neighbourhood Planning Bill - Consideration of Commons amendments - Lord Bourne of Aberystwyth

Legislation

Bus Services Bill [HL] - Consideration of Commons amendments - Lord Ahmad of Wimbledon

Legislation

Criminal Finances Bill - Report stage - Baroness Williams of Trafford

Legislation

Criminal Finances Bill - 3rd reading - Baroness Williams of Trafford

Short debate

Support for the steel industry and its role in the Government's industrial strategy - Lord Mendelsohn

Show Speakers List
We are unable to retrieve the list of speakers for this item of business. Please refer to the Lords Whip site.

10.00 pm

Estimated rising time

Legislation

Finance Bill - 1st reading - Baroness Neville-Rolfe

Grand Committees

No business scheduled

Select Committees

10.00 am

EU Energy and Environment Sub-Committee - Private Meeting

Location: Room 1, Palace of Westminster

10.30 am

Science and Technology Committee (Lords) - Private Meeting

Location: Room 4A, Palace of Westminster

10.30 am

EU Justice Sub-Committee - Oral Evidence Session
Brexit: consumer protection rights

(at 10:45 am)
Mr Pete Moorey, Head of Campaigns, Which?
Mr Matt Upton, Head of Consumer Policy, Citizens Advice

Location: Room 3, Palace of Westminster

3.15 pm

Communications Committee - Private Meeting

Location: Room 2, Palace of Westminster

3.30 pm

Economic Affairs Committee - Private Meeting

Location: Room 1, Palace of Westminster

3.45 pm

Secondary Legislation Scrutiny Committee (formerly Merits Committee) - Private Meeting

Location: Room 3A, Palace of Westminster

4.00 pm

European Union Committee - Private Meeting

Location: Room 3, Palace of Westminster

No business scheduled
